name: Pork Wontons
description: A classic Chinese recipe for homemade pork wontons. These dumplings feature a savory and aromatic filling of ground pork, fresh ginger, garlic, and spring onions, seasoned with Shaoxing wine and sesame oil, all encased in delicate wonton wrappers. They are versatile and perfect for boiling, frying, or adding to soups.

recipeInstructions.text: Mince the spring onion, garlic and ginger. Mix everything together thoroughly. If you want to check for seasoning, fry a little bit to taste and then adjust your seasonings accordingly.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix filling

recipeInstructions.text: To wrap, spoon about a tablespoon (maybe a little less) into the middle, dab water on 2 edges, fold over into a triangle and squeeze together making sure to exclude as much air as possible. Fold the opposite corners together and press together.
recipeInstructions.name: Wrap

notes: These wontons are super flexible and can be used in soups, deep fried or had boiled with chili sauce. You can use them immediately or freeze until required.
The timing for this assumes you're making this with other people. Otherwise it will take a bit longer. I find it takes me about 1 hour to prep the mixture and make about 40 wontons by myself.
Makes 40-60 wontons depending on how much filling you use.
